TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for a event that is raised when you click on a selected control or a designer region in a selected control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event is raised by the designer host for certain actions on a control on the design surface. For example, an event is raised when you click a selected control or a designer region in a selected control on the design surface.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event. When you click a selected control or a designer region of a selected control at design time, the designer host initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> event type, and then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property with a DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs object.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object indicates that you clicked a designer region, the default delegate in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class passes the DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A> method. Classes deriving from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A> method to process events that are raised when you click a control in the design host.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Region%2A> property represents the control designer region that the event applies to, if any. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs.Location%2A> property represents the location on the design surface that was clicked.
For more information about events and delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
